sections.title: Introduction
sections.definition:
The EIS Clinical Decisions API Glossary is the central hub for terminology used in APIs across the ART. This allows individual teams to create products that have a consistant voice for our customers.

To contribute to this glossary please see the [Contributing](contribute.md) page.

sections.title: Hypermedia
sections.definition: Clinical Decisions public APIs are hypermedia compliant in accordance with the [hypermedia guidelines](http://api-design-dev-guide.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/docs/design-guidelines/#hypermedia) of the EIS API Design Guide.

sections.title: Dublin Core (DC) Terms
sections.definition: These terms are externally managed by the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative. Details on term meanings and usage can be found on the [DC site](https://www.dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dcmi-terms/).

terms.title: aggregations
terms.definition: An array of total item counts aggregated by the values of a response field.

terms.title: slug
terms.definition: An SEO-friendly string designed to be added to the end of a URL to uniquely identify a resource in a particular context. Can consist of one or more path segments..

terms.title: id
terms.definition: The unique identifier for a resource.  Since the ID is used in the resource ID segment of the resource path, it must not contain forward slashes. See also [slug](#slug).

terms.title: _metadata
terms.definition: A required property of a collection resource, containing information about the response, including hypermedia [links](#links) and [totalItems](#totalitems), at a minimum.

terms.title: anchor
terms.definition: An HTML anchor used to identify (and link to) an element within a larger string of HTML. Anchors are represented in the HTML using the @id attribute.

terms.title: {prefix}Id
terms.definition: In query parameters only, used to distinguish the ID of the desired resource from those of other resources. For an example see [pubTypeId](#pubtypeid)

terms.title: slug
terms.definition: An SEO-friendly string designed to be added to the end of a URL to uniquely identify a resource in a particular context. Can consist of one or more path segments. For instance, DynaMed slugs are appended to the DynaMed URL to take users directly to individual articles. The slug is not the resource ID. For that, use [id](#id).

terms.title: field
terms.definition: The name of a field in the response.  In the case of aggregated item counts, the field by which counts are aggregated.  See also [aggregations](#aggregations).

terms.title: counts
terms.definition: In aggregated item counts, an object representing the total number of items for each field value.  See also [aggregations](#aggregations).

terms.title: items
terms.definition: An array containing the current page of the result list.

terms.title: page
terms.definition: A number representing the page of the response. A page will consist of an array of [items](#items).

terms.title: pageSize
terms.definition: The maximum number of items per page of the response.

terms.title: pageToken
terms.definition: A string identifying a previous result set for the purpose of navigating to additional pages of a paginated response. Useful in some cases more than others, such as when querying on a large data set.

terms.title: request
terms.definition:
An object property of a collection resource containing information about the parameters submitted in the request.

Used especially when the parameters submitted in the request may be changed before the GET action is performed, such as when a query term is translated.

terms.title: totalItems
terms.definition: Total count of resources in the collection regardless of pagination.

terms.title: totalPages
terms.definition: The total count of pages in the collection.

terms.title: links
terms.definition: An array of Link Description Objects that can be used to navigate the API.  For more details, see the [links array](http://api-design-dev-guide.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/docs/design-guidelines/#links-array) and [link description object](http://api-design-dev-guide.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/docs/design-guidelines/#link-description-object) sections of the EIS API Design Guide.

terms.title: rel
terms.definition: Relation type of the link.  Values must be selected from a standard set of terms.  A list of common relation types and other guidance related to this property can be found in the [link relation type](http://api-design-dev-guide.s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com/docs/design-guidelines/#link-relation-type) section of the EIS API Design Guide.

terms.title: href
terms.definition: Absolute URL pointing to the resource.

terms.title: method
terms.definition: The HTTP verb that must be used to make a request to the target link. This property must be included for all links that require a method other than GET. If the method property is omitted, a default value of GET is assumed.

terms.title: abstract
terms.definition: Descriptive summary of the resource.
terms.example: "abstract": "Promoting safe patient mobility using the assistive device"

terms.title: accessTime
terms.definition: Last time the resource was accessed. (ISO 8601)

terms.title: affiliationText
terms.definition: Text describing the professional affiliations of a contributor to a resource.  For an example in context see [contributors](#contributors).
terms.example: "affiliationText": "Site Director, Pulmonary and Critical Care Fellowship Program, and Clinical Professor of Medicine, Brown University Alpert Medical School; Rhode Island, United States"

terms.title: article
terms.definition: A publication containing one or more sections of content and a table of contents.

terms.title: available
terms.definition: Amount of available credits based on reviewed content.

terms.title: categoryPath
terms.definition: The hierachical category path.

terms.title: certificateType
terms.definition: The type of certificate.

terms.title: children
terms.definition: Array of items structurally similar to but hierarchically subordinate to the containing object.  Example use cases: table of contents (see [toc](#toc)) and specialty browse.
terms.example: "children": [{ "title": "Non-ST-elevation Acute Coronary Syndromes (NSTE-ACS)", "children": [{ "title": "Types", "resources": [{ "id": "T906417", "title": "Suspected Acute Coronary Syndrome", "slug": "/condition/suspected-acute-coronary-syndrome", "links": [{ "rel": "self", "href": "https://ebscois-live.apigee.net/medsapi-dynamed/v1/articles/T906417" }] }] }] }]

terms.title: claimed
terms.definition: Amount of claimed credits. Claimed credits are those which have been submitted for consideration to the accreditor.

terms.title: completedPhrase
terms.definition: The phrase completed via search suggestion.

terms.title: conflictsText
terms.definition: Text describing a contributor's conflicts of interest, if any.  For an example in context, see [contributors](#contributors).
terms.example: "conflictsText": "Dr. Nici declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest."

terms.title: content
terms.definition: The substance or content of any part of a resource, in a structured format such as XML, HTML or JSON. For unstructured content, use [text](#text). See also [{prefix}Content](#prefixcontent).

terms.title: {prefix}Content
terms.definition: The substance or content of any part of a resource, in a structured format such as XML, HTML or JSON. Used instead of [content](#content) when more than one property of an object contains structured content. If no disambiguation is required, use [content](#content). For unstructured content, use [text](#text). Examples: [noteContent](#notecontent), [panelContent](#panelcontent)

terms.title: contentLocations
terms.definition: List of locations of the given resource in the content.

terms.title: consensusDetails
terms.definition: Collection of content snippets describing the consensus details for the article.
terms.example:
"consensusDetails": [{ "anchor": "GUID-A2F4CE2A-184D-4187-B2EF-6D2FD17FB43E__CONSENSUSDETAIL", "noteContent": "
Content referenced with “Consensus” in Hospitalist Focused Content is supported by a combination of the best available evidence and expert opinion put forth by a panel of Hospitalists.
", "panelContent": "

Panel participants:

  • Dr. Quintana-Garcia declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
" }]

terms.title: contributors
terms.definition: Descriptions of the contributors to the resource.
terms.example: "contributors": [{ "label": "Topic Editor", "shortName": "Dr. Nici", "conflictsText": "Dr. Nici declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.", "affiliationText": "Site Director, Pulmonary and Critical Care Fellowship Program, and Clinical Professor of Medicine, Brown University Alpert Medical School; Rhode Island, United States", "fullName": "Linda Nici MD" }]

terms.title: copyright
terms.definition: The copyright details of a resource.
terms.example: "copyright": "Cirpaciu D, Goanta CM, Cirpaciu MD. Recurrences of Bell's palsy. J Med Life. 2014;7 Spec No. 3:68-77. Reproduced under Creative Commons Attribution License 2.0."

terms.title: creditHours
terms.definition: Number of hours for this credit.

terms.title: creditType
terms.definition: Type of credit.

terms.title: credits
terms.definition: Array of objects that contain credits information.

terms.title: degreeFullName
terms.definition: Full name of degree.

terms.title: description
terms.definition: Textual description of a resource or other object.  For an example in context see [image](#image).
terms.example: "description": "A patient with right facial palsy, dynamic asymmetry."

terms.title: documentation
terms.definition: Relevant documentation.

terms.title: eventType
terms.definition: Event type for the resource.

terms.title: fields
terms.definition: The fields included in the request/response.

terms.title: firstName
terms.definition: First name of relevant person.

terms.title: fullName
terms.definition: The full name of a person or intitution.  See also [shortName](#shortname).

terms.title: hasChildren
terms.definition: Indicates if the object has children. See also [children](#children).

terms.title: hidden
terms.definition: Value indicating whether the parent resource should be hidden from users.  In DynamicHealth, this value is determined by an institution for all users at the institution.

terms.title: image
terms.definition: A resource describing an image.
terms.example: { "title": "Facial palsy in Lyme Disease", "copyright": "", "imageProvider": "Centers for Disease Control and Prevention", "description": "This patient presented with a case of facial palsy caused by an infection by the bacterial spirochete Borrelia burgdorferi, and was subsequently diagnosed with Lyme disease. In addition to multiple (secondary) erythema migrans lesions, an early disseminated Lyme disease infection may manifest itself as a disease of the nervous system, the musculoskeletal system, or the heart.", "id": "i502636", "links": [ { "rel": "external", "href": "http://res.cloudinary.com/eis-live/image/authenticated/f_auto/v1/EBSCOHealth/CCMS/i502636?__cld_token__=exp=1590183968~hmac=f5df648354b6ab876a023e1ac291d812158d996e5bc8189c897d928d7aafc1c0" } ], "contentLocations": [ { "parent": { "title": "Bell Palsy", "slug": "/condition/bell-palsy" }, "anchor": "I502636" } ] }

terms.title: images
terms.definition: A collection of [image](#image) resources.

terms.title: imageProvider
terms.definition: Source of an image described by an [image](#image) resource.

terms.title: initiatedBy
terms.definition: Initiating source of the search.

terms.title: label
terms.definition: A brief description or designation.  To see an example in context, see [contributors](#contributors).

terms.title: lastName
terms.definition: Last name of relevant person.

terms.title: lastUpdate
terms.definition: Last update information.

terms.title: lastViewTimestamp
terms.definition: Date and time resource last viewed.

terms.title: noteContent
terms.definition: Snippet of content containing a note. An instance of [{prefix}Content](#prefixcontent). For an example in context, see [consensusDetails](#consensusdetails).

terms.title: notes
terms.definition: Related notes.

terms.title: panelContent
terms.definition: Snippet of content containing information about a panel of experts.  An instance of [{prefix}Content](#prefixcontent).  For an example in context, see [consensusDetails](#consensusdetails).

terms.title: parent
terms.definition: Reference to a resource that contains the given resource as a subresource.  See also [contentLocations](#contentlocations).

terms.title: paths
terms.definition: Hierarchial path to a section or subsection of content.  For an example in context, see [sections](#sections).

terms.title: patientFamilyEducation
terms.definition: information relevant to patient-family education.
terms.example:
"patientFamilyEducation": "Boxford University of Medicine
Massachusetts College of Studying"

terms.title: postProcedureSteps
terms.definition: Post-procedure steps defined for a skill.

terms.title: practiceChangingUpdate
terms.definition: Value indicating whether a given update to an article indicates a need for a change in practice.  For an example in context, see [updates](#updates).

terms.title: prepared
terms.definition: Amount of prepared credits. Prepared credits are for content that has been reviewed and information needed by the accreditor has been created.

terms.title: preProcedureSteps
terms.definition: Medical pre-procedure steps defined for a skill.

terms.title: presentedAs
terms.definition: The format of the response.

terms.title: prevSearchTerm
terms.definition: The previous search term.

terms.title: procedureSteps
terms.definition: Procedure steps defined for a skill.

terms.title: pubType
terms.definition: The classification given to a content resource. When specifying pubTypes in query parameters, use [pubTypeId](#pubtypeid).

terms.title: pubTypeId
terms.definition: Used in query parameters only (e.g., the search endpoint), to distinguish pubType IDs from the IDs of other resources. When including pubTypes in responses, use [pubType](#pubtype).  An instance of [{prefix}Id](#prefixid).

terms.title: pubTypeIds
terms.definition: A collection of [pubTypeId](#pubtypeid) values.

terms.title: purpose
terms.definition: Purpose description.
terms.example:
"purpose": "Demo populated fields
Demo multi line fields"

terms.title: query
terms.definition: The query term submitted in the request. Can be a query parameter or a property of the "request" object in the response. For the query term used by the endpoint to perform the GET action use [queryUsed](#queryused).

terms.title: queryLanguage
terms.definition: The language of the query term submitted in the request.  Language codes are two-letter abbreviations as outlined in [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes).

terms.title: queryMatches
terms.definition: Collection of objects that provide location details for the matching terms in [queryUsed](#queryused).

terms.title: queryUsed
terms.definition: The term used by the endpoint itself to perform the GET action.  This may or may not be the same as the query term submitted in the request.  For the query submitted in the request, see [query](#query).

terms.title: redFlags
terms.definition: Red flags associated with a skill.

terms.title: referenceLinks
terms.definition: Collection of content snippets containing hyperlinked citations for an article.
terms.example:
"referenceLinks": [ { "anchor": "GUID-165FCFE4-2101-4D94-9757-4D7F919F01E2__ANC_1795582378", "content": "
  • Subbiah R, Gula LJ, Klein GJ, et al. Workup of the cardiac arrest survivor: for the symposium on sudden cardiac death for progress in cardiovascular diseases. Prog Cardiovasc Dis. 2008 Nov-Dec;51(3):195-203
    • " } ]

terms.title: request
terms.definition: The request submitted to the endpoint. May contain query parameters or the request body, depending on the endpoint.

terms.title: resource
terms.definition: Resource content relevant to result.

terms.title: searchTime
terms.definition: In milliseconds, the time a search took to execute.

terms.title: sections
terms.definition: A collection of sections that together constitute the main content of a resource.

terms.title: shortName
terms.definition: The shortened form of name for a person or institution.  See also [fullName](#fullname).

terms.title: status
terms.definition: Current status.

terms.title: submitDate
terms.definition: Date submitted.

terms.title: suggestions
terms.definition: Collection of suggested resources or searches related to the provided query.

terms.title: suggestionType
terms.definition: In search [suggestions](#suggestions), the type of search suggestion desired or returned.  Example values: title, term.

terms.title: supplies
terms.definition: Supplies related to a skill.

terms.title: text
terms.definition: Unstructured textual content. For structured content, use [content](#content). See also [{prefix}Content](#prefixcontent)
terms.example: "text": "hyperoxia associated with increased in-hospital mortality in patients with cardiac arrest."

terms.title: {prefix}Text
terms.definition: Unstructured textual content. Used instead of [text](#text) when more than one property of an object contains textual content. If no disambiguation is required, use [text](#text). For structured content, use [content](#content).
terms.example: "conflictsText": "Dr. Oettgen declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest."

terms.title: timestamp
terms.definition: Timestamp in UTC that conforms to [ISO 8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

terms.title: title
terms.definition: The title of a given resource.

terms.title: toc
terms.definition: Table of contents for an article resource, represented as an array of [title](#title) and [anchor](#anchor) pairs, optionally with [children](#children) to indicate hierarchy.

terms.title: translationSuccessful
terms.definition: A field indicating if the language can be translated. Error indicating that the search engine was not able to find the requested language or the language is not supported. If the language can be found but cannot be translated, a successful message will also be returned, but will contains zero results. This field is not set if no translation was needed, or the translation was successful.

terms.title: updates
terms.definition: Snippets of content describing updates recently made to an article resource.
terms.example: "updates": [ { "text": "systemic antibiotics may improve exacerbation resolution at end of treatment in non-ICU inpatients with moderate-to-severe exacerbation of COPD (Ann Intern Med 2020 Feb 25 early online)", "timestamp": "2020-03-09T16:18:54.000Z", "practiceChangingUpdate": false, "anchor": "EFFICACY_ABX__LI_RJS_YCC_ZKB" } ]

terms.title: username
terms.definition: User name of relevant person.

terms.title: visibility
terms.definition: Value indicating whether the parent resource should be hidden from users.  In DynamicHealth, this value is determined by an institution for all users at the institution.

terms.title: DC.Date.Created
terms.definition: Created date.

terms.title: DC.Date.Revised
terms.definition: Last revised date.

terms.title: DC.Format
terms.definition: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

terms.title: DC.Identifier
terms.definition: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

terms.title: DC.language
terms.definition: A language of the resource.

terms.title: DC.Publisher
terms.definition: An entity responsible for making the resource available.

terms.title: DC.rights.owner
terms.definition: Rights owner.

terms.title: DC.Title
terms.definition: A name given to the resource.

terms.title: DC.Type
terms.definition: The nature or genre of the resource.
